devs.person: Requirements coordinator and quality control point of contact between Cosylab and EPICS community.

version.fix: "New record dialog" record type JComboBox bug workaround (problems with removing items).
Not all fields are available as link destinations.
Type combo-box has multiple instances of the same type.
version.enhancement: If DBF_MENU or DBF_DEVICE field has defined 'initial' value, than "<intial_value>*" (e.g. "INVALID*") is used instead "<none>".
version.comment: For DBF_MENU or DBF_DEVICE fields only values with "<intial_value>*" and "<none>" are threated as default, e.g. "INVALID*" is default, but "INVALID" not.
Navigation using arrow keys to be added.
version.bug: Changing record type in the "New record dialog" erases record name.

version.fix: Not all fields are available as link destinations.
version.comment: Need a better plan? Suggestion: Define field order in DBDs prioritized by usage.
version.fix: Print Preview doesn't erase previous preview.
version.enhancement: Pan when the cursor hits the edge of the drawing (while dragging).
Usage of JAXP 1.1 compilant Apache Crimson XML parser.
All setting files are now stored in VDCT_DIR/config directory, where VDCT_DIR is environment variable (current directory if not specified or invalid).
Plugins (alpha state - currently DebugPlugin and ExportPlugin are supported). Configuration file is config/plugins.xml.
version.comment: The "One Up Level" button in javax.swing.FileChooser is part of JRE implementation. No problems noticed on Windows platform.
For proper font scaling fonts have to be "flexible" (bitmap fonts are not recommended). No problems noticed on Windows, Linux (XFree86 4.0.3) platform.
version.bug: Process options shown by link fields are not properly centered, they can be overdrawn by a link line (large zoom in).
version.comment: VisualDCT does not handle invalid DBs having unquoted substitution variables as record names (see EPICS IOC Application Developers Guide, R3.13, June 18, page 35).
Should connectors be drawn always over other objects? Anyway connectors can be easily accessed (hilited, clicked, dragged) even if they are under other object.
Agreed to act as requirements coordinator and quality control point of contact between Cosylab and EPICS community.
